resources.string: FairEmail is an open source email app focused on privacy and security. For this reason some features might work differently from what you are used to.
For example, messages are reformatted by default to remove unsafe elements and to improve readability, and opening links needs to be confirmed for safety. Both can be disabled if desired.

THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE AUTHOR \'\'AS IS\'\' AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
Bugs in the Android version of this particular device cause crashes
Remaining storage space on the device: %1$s
With Android 14/15 beta, \'App not responding\' notifications occasionally occur. Google is working on a fix. Please do not blame the app for this Android problem!
Progress notifications of longer running activities
Your email provider is responsible for filtering spam. An email app does not have all the data needed to do this reliably.
Messages from blocked senders will not be downloaded. If "Leave messages on server" is not enabled, these messages will be lost permanently!
Blocking means automatically moving to the spam folder
Blocking a sender is a free feature. Blocking a sender domain uses filter rules, which is a pro feature.
This will reset all lists and options that could result in blocking senders
Note that the app cannot prevent the email server from moving messages to the spam folder!
This can increase battery usage and incorrectly mark messages as spam
This will delete all block sender rules
Sending will be retried on internet connection changes or pulling down on the outbox
Redacted: biometric or PIN authentication enabled
Setting up an account is just three steps and after that you can send and receive emails
There is no need to change any other options

FairEmail was developed to help you protect your privacy and represents literally thousands of hours of work. If you have any problems, please contact me first for support before leaving a bad review. I am happy to help!
FairEmail does not display ads and does not track or analyze your behavior. Bugsnag is used for error reporting and is disabled by default.
Some providers make it difficult to add an account. Please do not blame FairEmail for this, but ask for support instead.
The entered email address is used to query the email server and autoconfig.thunderbird.net for configuration information
In most cases the wizard button can be used to add an account, otherwise the server addresses can be entered or changed manually using the manual setup option
The wizard can be used multiple times to set up multiple accounts
I need a new email address
The quick setup wizard for \"Other Provider\" above usually works too, and is easier than entering all the server data.
Please see your email provider\'s documentation for the correct email server configuration
You can configure the name, color and swipe actions in the account settings, and configure a signature in the identity settings
Incoming email only (email cannot be sent!)
The email provider has approved OAuth only for the Play Store and GitHub version
Authorizing Google accounts will work in the Play Store and GitHub version only because Android checks the digital app signature
Please grant permissions to select an account and read your name
Google will ask for permissions to read, compose, send and permanently delete all your email. FairEmail will never delete your messages without your explicit consent.
If Chrome is signed in to an account, a new account can only be added through Android. This can be avoided by logging out of Chrome via the Chrome sync settings.
In case of the error message \"You\'re signed in to the maximum number of accounts\", you need to log out the browser from all Google accounts.
In the case of an alias address, the Office 365 wizard should probably be used.
Due to changes in Microsoft\'s security policies, from September 16, 2024, only the Outlook/Hotmail/Live wizard will work.
Why do I need to select an on-device account?
I want to authorize an account with a password instead of an on-device account
The error \'AUTHENTICATE failed\' can be caused by IMAP/SMTP being disabled by the system administrator
Please try the \'Other provider\' quick setup wizard.
Please try the \'Outlook/Hotmail/Live\' quick setup wizard.

The error \'User is authenticated but not connected\' mostly means that IMAP is disabled. In the case of a consumer Outlook account, please go to the Outlook website, tap on the settings wheel at the top right, select \'Mail\', select \'Forwarding and IMAP\', and in the section \'POP and IMAP\' enable \'Let devices and apps use IMAP\'. In the case of a corporate, education, etc. account, please contact the system administrator of the email server.
Authorize an existing account again (otherwise create a new account)
When using Edge browser, make sure that \'Block opening external apps\' in the \'Privacy, security and services\' settings is \'Off\'
When using Brave browser, you must enable the option in Brave\'s settings to allow app links to open in apps outside of Brave
Authorization requires a working browser which allows opening app links (often a security setting), so that at the end the authorization token can be transferred to the app
Try to set up an account manually using the settings provided by your email provider
Please double check your email address and password and make sure external access (IMAP/SMTP) is enabled for your account
You must use the Outlook / Office 365 quick setup wizard for this account (required by Microsoft)
This provider requires an app password instead of the account password, please check the instructions of your provider
When enrolled in the advanced protection program it is not possible to use a third party email app. This is a restriction imposed by Google.
An account has successfully been added
No sent messages folder has been selected. Sent messages might not be stored.
To edit the name, color, swipe actions, etc.
Is this app free to use?
Contact permissions are required to look up contact info and to suggest contacts
Notification permissions are required to show notifications for new messages in the status bar
Which permissions are needed and why?
To send and receive email reliably in the background
Battery optimizations should be disabled for the app to ensure reliable sending and receiving of messages in the background
Although this may sound contradictory, turning off battery optimizations for this app will result in less battery usage
This device might stop the sync service
Why should battery optimizations be disabled?
In the next Android dialog change "Not optimized" to "All apps", select this app and select "Don\'t optimize"
This is probably required for this device
The app cannot be started automatically
If enabled, unstable connections, old network hardware, etc. may result in higher battery usage
You might need to use an app password
This will only remove accounts from the app
Since the settings file contains all settings and account information, it is encrypted with a password. The password is required to import the settings again, so please don\'t forget it!
The export file will contain all settings and data, but no messages and no images referenced in signatures
The input dialogs may be scrollable!
Password contains control or whitespace characters
Incorrect password, or damaged settings file
Light background for original message view
The Material You colors can be configured in the Android Wallpaper & style settings
This will automatically switch to a light/dark theme on day/night mode, if supported by Android
Your Gmail accounts will continue to work after May 30, 2022
Some of your Gmail accounts may stop working after May 30, 2022
Your Outlook accounts will continue to work after September 16, 2024
Some of your Outlook/Hotmail/Live accounts will stop working after September 16, 2024
You are navigating to the more advanced options. All options have commonly used standard values, which you do not need to change unless you have a different preference.
The options are categorized by tab, divided into sections, organized by appearance or use, and searchable.
You can configure an account by tapping the wizard button on the main configuration screen.
All options have commonly used standard values, which don\'t need to be changed to use the app
Always receive messages for these accounts
Periodically check for new messages while on a metered network
Periodically check for new messages while on an unmetered network
Check if old messages were removed from the server
Gmail message grouping style for Gmail accounts
Group messages by sender and subject
Enable synchronization for new user folders
Check reply address on synchronizing messages
Check sender email addresses on synchronizing messages
Check if the sender\'s domain name is on a spam block list
Move messages from domains on a block list to the spam folder
Skip messages from domains on a block list (POP3 only)
Block lists aren\'t perfect and may block more than just spam!
Suggest addresses found in sent messages
Suggest addresses found in received messages
Sort suggested addresses on frequency of use
Automatically delete local contacts older than and used fewer than:
Use the identity color for the bottom action bar
Show send button at the top
Create a new draft message for shared addresses and files
Short pressing on the answer button will:
Long pressing on the answer button will:
The answer button actions can also be configured in the send settings tab page
Not all actions are possible without a selection menu!
Save draft revisions for undo and redo
Automatically save a draft after every paragraph
Automatically save a draft after every sentence
Use monospaced font for plain text messages
Automatically select identities for new messages
Prefix subject only once on replying or forwarding
Insert a horizontal line before a reply/forward header
Limit the number of nested quotes
On discard draft, permanently delete draft
On replying to a message, save the reply in the same folder
Also for messages in the inbox
Sending will be retried on connectivity changes
If some addresses are invalid, a message will still be sent to the other addresses
The message was not sent to all recipients
Send plain text only by default
Automatically plain text only when replying to a plain text only message
Start a new conversation when forwarding
Check recipient email addresses before sending
Automatically download messages and attachments on a metered connection up to
Download messages and attachments while roaming
Download plain text only parts by default (if available)
Require a validated captive portal connection
Bind sockets to the active network
Clear DNS cache on connectivity changes
Check host names against server certificates
Use Bouncy Castle\'s secure socket provider (JSSE)
Minimum screen size for splitting the screen
Collapse row or column when closing a conversation
Hide top toolbar when scrolling messages
Use app background color for Android navigation bar
Show account categories in the navigation menu
You can enable the options again in the display settings
Show the last sync time in the navigation menu
Show number of locally stored messages in the navigation menu
Show number of unread drafts in the navigation menu
Show the number of unread messages in the pinned navigation menu
Show a star for accounts/folders with newly received unread messages
Use card style instead of tabular style
The account category can be configured in the advanced account options via the main settings screen
Use beige background when using card style (light themes only)
Use card color as background color when using tabular style
Use shadow for unread messages when using card style
Use highlight color instead of accent color
Use divider lines when using tabular style
Use a gray background color for unread messages when using table style
Group by week instead of day
Show fixed date header at the top
Always show both a date and a time
Show number of unread messages in conversations
Left/right indent received/sent messages in conversations
Show a color stripe or color dot
Show Brand Indicators for Message Identification (BIMI)
Scan only the first %1$s of the web page
Require DMARC verification for external images
Prefer a contact name over a sent name
Underline the sender when the sender is known as local \'to\' contact
Show Gmail labels in message header
Show colored background instead of colored stars
Vertically align keywords, preview text, and notes
Show attachments after the message text
Show image thumbnails after the message text
Zoom message text also in the message editor
Zoom original messages to fit the screen
Use high contrast for message text
Use monospaced font for message text by default
Use monospaced font for preformatted text
Show extra buttons at the bottom of a message
Show relative conversation position with a dot
Use account color as background color for conversation action bar
Show the number of messages or conversations in the top action bar
The underlying checks can be configured in the receive settings
Scroll to top on receiving new messages
Double tap to mark message read/unread
Swipe left/right to go to next/previous conversation
Volume up/down to go to next/previous conversation
Use up/down arrows for next/previous conversation
Automatically expand the first message when the conversation is read
Expand only one message at a time
Collapse messages in a conversation with multiple messages on \'back\'
Delay automatically marking messages as read
Automatically close conversations after sending messages
Close conversations on marking messages as unread
Collapse messages which are manually marked as read or unread
Show non-obtrusive quick scroll up/down icons
Show quick actions when messages are selected
Always go back to the folder list from a message list
Automatically mark messages read on moving messages
Automatically remove stars from messages on moving messages
Automatically add star on snoozing messages
Automatically remove star on unsnoozing messages
Automatically block the sender when reporting spam
Automatically hide the answer button when scrolling
Swipe expanded messages to the right to reply
When moving selected conversations, move all messages
When moving a conversation, also move sent messages
When swiping a conversation to the trash, trash all messages
When permanently deleting a message, delete all Gmail labels
Show launcher icon with number of new messages
Let the number of new messages match the number of notifications
Keep notifications private when the device is locked
Show notifications when in the background only
Delay notifications while on a call
Delay notifications while Android Auto is connected
Show notifications with a preview text only
Remove new message notification on tapping on notification
Remove new message notifications on viewing message list
Show account or folder name as subtext
Only send notifications with a message preview to wearables
Show notification content when using biometric authentication
Open folder when opening new message
Briefly turn on the screen for new message notifications
Use background service to synchronize messages
A background service can be stopped by Android at any time, but doesn\'t require a status bar notification
Check domain block lists for suspicious links
Attempt to recognize and disable tracking images
Send app name and version to email server
Hide from recent apps screen and prevent taking screenshots
Load updated Emoji from Google Play Services
Use lists to warn about tracking links
Use lists to recognize tracking images
This will delete all app data from your device, including configured email accounts, messages, settings, and any collected data.
Any email received with the below words in the subject line will automatically and immediately delete the app data
The app data will be irreversibly deleted!

The default encryption method (PGP or S/MIME) will be stored per identity after sending a signed or encrypted message. The encryption method can be selected before sending in the send options dialog box (long press the send button).
Automatically encrypt when all recipients\' keys are available
Automatically encrypt when replying to an encrypted message
Please be aware that not all email clients support all algorithms. The default algorithms SHA256 and AES128 are commonly supported.
This will open the Android security settings. Keys and certificates can generally be found under Advanced - Encryption and credentials.
Add actions to the Android power menu
Add \'send to self\' to Android\'s share menu
Add \'FairEmail search\' to Android text selection menu
Sort reply templates by frequency of use
Provide reply templates to other apps
Show frequently used contacts in Android share menu
Show a filter icon when rules were applied
The cloud services below are not part of the app. Any payments will go directly to the cloud service and not to the app developer.
An integration which isn\'t configured is completely inert. No third-party libraries are being used to prevent tracking and analytics.
Check paragraph after a new line
I want to use an SD card
Periodically check if FairEmail is still active
Check for test versions on BitBucket
Turning this off can result in a significant increase in battery usage!
Use Android app chooser for links
Use Android app chooser for files
View files in a separate task
If you change this setting, please do not complain if you accidentally deleted messages irreversibly
If receiving messages is disabled, it is still possible to manually receive messages by pulling down the message list
This can cause high battery usage!

Periodically checking for new messages will compare local and remote messages every time, which is an expensive operation that may result in extra battery usage, especially if there are a lot of messages. Always receive will prevent this by continuously following changes.
This might change the sync frequency to save battery usage depending on the capabilities and behavior of the email servers
Tap on a time to set a time
Schedules can be disabled in the advanced account settings
This reduces data usage, but new messages might be missed if the email server doesn\'t follow the standards
Some providers store messages with an unknown, invalid or future date as messages without date
Some providers don\'t support this properly, which may cause synchronizing none or all messages
This can cause high data usage!
When disabled, unread messages are kept on the device forever
This will transfer extra data and consume extra battery power, especially if a lot of messages are stored on the device
This only applies to newly received messages and can break existing groups
Only messages received in the last %1$d hours
Disabling this will reduce data and battery usage somewhat, but will disable updating the list of folders too
Periodically synchronize the folder list in addition to after connecting to an account
This will check the results of DKIM, SPF and DMARC authentication as performed by the email server
This will show a green shield only if a message was transported securely by all servers
This will check if the domain name of the sender and the reply address are the same
This will check if DNS MX records exist
This will slow down synchronizing messages
This will always return to the folder list of the related account from a message list
When pulling down the folders or accounts list
If disabled, only email addresses will be used when selecting contacts
In addition to contacts provided by Android. Contact data will be stored for newly sent or received messages only when enabled.
This only applies to local contacts because contacts in the Android address book are not linked to specific accounts
This will select the last identity used when selecting a recipient for new messages
Show a warning when the message text or the subject is empty or when an attachment might be missing
The email server could still add the messages to the sent message folder
Very light or very dark colors will result in illegible messages on the recipients\' side
A recipient might miss your reply, for example when a longer message is being truncated
Otherwise, add shared addresses or files to the current draft message
Insert \'-- \' between the text and the signature
This can result in too little or too much text being removed
Metered connections are generally mobile connections or paid Wi-Fi hotspots
Disabling this option will disable receiving and sending messages on mobile internet connections
Assuming no roaming within the EU
This will increase battery, data and storage space usage
Enabling this will limit data usage, but messages will be shown without styling and without images
The plain text part does not always contain the full message!
Enabling this can cause connection problems on some devices and may increase battery usage
This can result in not synchronizing messages, for example when using a VPN, but also in other situations
The read/write timeout will be set to the double of the connection timeout. Higher values will result in more battery use.
Disabling this will relax checking of server certificates
Enabling this will disable weak SSL protocols and ciphers, which can lead to connection problems
Enabling this will require secure connections to download images, etc.
Messages headers will always be fetched when roaming. You can use the device\'s roaming setting to disable internet while roaming.
Fetch more messages when scrolling down
Switching to a more compact layout and changing the message text size can be done in the top action bar menu in the message view
Long press any folder in the folder list to add or remove it from the list of unified folders
Messages are only grouped by date if they are sorted by time
Whether this works depends on the Android version and variant
This will split the screen into parts
This is a condition intended for foldable devices
Group messages related to each other
The accent color of the theme will be used for highlighting
This cloud service is free to use
This cloud service has a free tier
There might be a privacy risk
Names will only be shown when available
Only available when message text has been downloaded
Scrolling can be slow due to a bug in some Android versions when the number of lines is more than one
This can result in very small fonts
Plain text only messages will be considered as preformatted
This applies to reformatted messages only
Inline images are images included in the message
The contents of compressed files (%1$s) with more than %2$s files or with files larger than %3$s will not be shown
This will more accurately display messages, but possibly with a delay

Android may ask for permission to access the selected folder, even though the app doesn\'t need it. You can cancel the selection dialog to restore the default folder (usually the \'Download\' folder).
Restore last app state when restarted via the launcher icon within %1$d minutes
Automatically open message when there is just one message or just one unread message in a conversation
The answer button will not be shown when multiple messages are expanded because it is unclear which message the button applies to
Automatically marking messages as read on expanding can be disabled in the advanced account settings of each account
Automatically close conversations when all messages are archived, sent or trashed
Most providers do not allow modified sender addresses
The address won\'t be shown, but will be added on sending
This address will be used for SMTP MAIL FROM
There will be a warning when sending to another domain
The details of the selected contact will be used for vCard attachments
Disabling this option might be harmful to your privacy
This can result in odd looking and double texts
A PIN takes precedence over biometrics authentication
Some servers do not accept a generic user agent string
The Google server knows which addresses are being looked up
At most three actions will be shown
Connected means something is being projected, such as a map for navigation
New message notifications will always be removed on being swiped away and on marking messages read
Tap on the channel name to set the channel properties
To set the default sound, etc.
How do I configure notifications for accounts, folders and senders?
For wearables that can show the full text (up to 5,000 characters)
This delays showing of notifications until the message text has been downloaded
Notifications are only sent to a wearable after the message text has been downloaded
This is required for Android Auto support
The target folder can be configured in the account settings
Requires disabling sensitive notifications in Android\'s settings
This Android version does not support notification grouping
This Android version does not support notification channels
Enabling this improves search performance, but also increases battery and storage space usage
This will significantly increase battery and storage space usage!
This will show ugly debug information at various places
When manually cleaning, this will remove attachments from messages that are no longer synchronized
This will delete all temporary files
This feature is for synchronizing configuration data between devices.

All data will be end-to-end encrypted and the cloud server cannot see the username, password and content of the data. Data on the cloud server will be automatically deleted after one month of inactivity.
Logging in for the first time will automatically create a cloud account
You can change the password by wiping the data and logging in again

Cloud sync accounts need to be activated by sending an email within 24 hours. Please use the same email address you used to activate the pro features. A cloud sync account and the email address will not be linked.

Only enabled accounts and identities will be synchronized. Gmail accounts authenticated via Android cannot be synchronized. Folder properties will not be synchronized. Existing accounts on the device will never be deleted.
In many cases, an alias address must first be verified via the website of the mail provider
This will set the swipe left and right action for all IMAP accounts
This field should be empty in most cases
It is seldom necessary to turn on this option, moreover, data usage will increase!
Identity colors take precedence over folder and account colors
Use name when sender address has been edited
Copy the name from the received message
Regex to match username of incoming email addresses
Most servers do not support this
In case of \'invalid greeting\', \'requires valid address\' or a similar error, try to change this setting
Also prevents you from replying to yourself
Frequency of refreshing the connection for push messages or frequency of checking for new messages
This will refresh the connection more actively, but also use more battery power
Disable this only in case of empty messages or corrupt attachments
Enabling this will increase battery and data usage
For reliable synchronization of a Gmail account, the Gmail quick setup wizard should be used whenever possible
Only a limited number of DNS servers support DNSSEC
Insecure connections should only be allowed on trusted networks and never on public networks
Only some email providers support DANE
You can enable this for account specific notifications
Usernames and passwords are usually case sensitive
No key selected or no keys available
Use local IP address instead of host name
After downloading messages from the server, the messages remain on the server
After deleting messages from the device, the messages will remain on the server
When messages are deleted from the server, the messages remain on the device
Maximum number of messages to download (blank for all)
This is the maximum number of messages that will be kept on the device
Enter a positive number to download the messages at the end (most common) and a negative number to download the messages at the beginning (least common)
Changes will be applied to new messages only
There is no spam folder selected for this account
The default email address is determined by the primary identity of the primary account
Sending emails requires an identity to be configured, and a drafts folder to be selected in the account settings
This provider uses a proprietary email protocol and therefore it is not possible to use third party email clients
This provider does not support push messages. This will delay reception of new messages and increase battery usage.
This provider does not support UTF-8
The sender (%1$s) and reply domain (%2$s) differ
An identity is required to send emails
A drafts folder is required to send emails
Sending emails requires a drafts folder to be selected in the account settings

The POP3 protocol can only download and delete messages from the inbox. It is not possible to mark messages as read, report spam, move messages, etc. Consider using the IMAP protocol whenever possible.
If your device is lost or stolen, sent messages might be lost.
If a POP3 server does not support the UIDL command, the data usage might be high. So, adjust the poll frequency below accordingly.
The POP3 protocol does not support creating folders
Long press on an account to display options, for example to disable or delete an account
Long press on an identity to display options, like copy to create alias identities
This might be caused by the VPN that is being used
The Android account manager could be blocked by a VPN, firewall, ad blocker, etc., preventing it from obtaining an access token
Please double check the port number
Please double check the protocol (SSL/TLS or STARTTLS)
This account needs to be authenticated again, which can be done via the quick setup wizard

Due to Google\'s Play Store policies, it is no longer possible to support insecure connections to email servers with certificate issues for the version of FairEmail distributed in the Play Store. Therefore, this issue can only be resolved by your email provider - the above error information may help them resolve this issue.
This will result in a single download of older messages, so it will not result in more battery usage for everyday use

Messages will be fetched as fast as the email server can deliver them and stored as fast as the device can store and index them. The limiting factor is usually the speed of the device\'s internal storage space.
Please keep in mind that storing a lot of messages (ten thousand or more) on your device can cause delays because the internal storage space is not infinitely fast.
This will permanently delete all messages marked for deletion
Delete all trashed messages of all accounts permanently?
Delete all spam messages of all accounts permanently?
This will delete all messages both from the device and the server
All contacts shown and not shown will be deleted, even if searched!
Deleting operations can result in disappearing messages and synchronization problems
Hide folder if all messages are read
Only in the account and unified folder list
Check periodically instead of continuous synchronize
Most email servers allow push messages for a handful of folders only!
Automatically download message texts and attachments
Add the number of unread messages to the account
Classify new messages in this folder
Automatically move classified messages to this folder
Increasing this value will increase battery and data usage
Old messages will be removed from the device, but will remain on the server
Set system folders to periodically check for new messages
Set user folders to periodically check for new messages
Automatically move old messages to trash
Old messages are messages that are no longer kept on the device
Deletion from the archive folder is not always allowed by the email server
Some providers require new folders to be created below the inbox. In this case, you can long press the inbox in the folder list and select \'Create subfolder\'.
Permanently delete this folder and any messages it contains?
Local notes are not stored on the mail server and are therefore only available in this app on this device
Downloading images might take some time
To forward messages, the raw (original) messages need to be downloaded from the email server. This requires an internet connection and the messages must still be stored on the email server.
This can be prevented by enabling always downloading raw message files in the connection settings
Automatically confirm after a few seconds
The actual actions available depend on the account type and configuration
Up to %1$d actions will be shown
To delete attachments, a new message must be added and the old message must be deleted. Since this may fail, the old message will be moved to the trash.
This read receipt only acknowledges that the message was displayed. There is no guarantee that the recipient has read the message contents.
Your message wasn\'t delivered because the address couldn\'t be found.
No suitable audio recorder app available
FairEmail does not have permission to read this file directly
This can be solved by selecting the file with a more modern file manager app or by granting permission to read files
The app used to select the file didn\'t grant permission to read it
No or no suitable internet connection
Connecting to one or more accounts …
The originally received message will be included
Search on server is not available for this account
Select a folder for a complex search
Message too large to completely reformat
Message too large to display completely
Message too large for the available memory (%1$d)
Unused inline images will be removed on send
Messages moved across accounts will be downloaded again resulting in extra data usage
Some attachments or images were not downloaded and could not be added
I understand that permanently deleting messages is irreversible
Showing the original message can leak privacy sensitive information
Displaying the original message on a dark background is not possible as it may make dark texts and images invisible
Always show images on showing original messages
Showing images can leak privacy sensitive information
Images recognized as tracking images will not be shown
Show AMP variant of the message?
AMP messages are designed to be dynamic and to interact with the internet and can therefore by definition be used to track you
Delete local messages? Messages will remain on the remote server.
Error reporting will help improve FairEmail
You have been using FairEmail for a while. It would be appreciated if you could rate FairEmail in the Play Store.
This message will only appear once, unless you select \'Later\'
You are using a version of a third party

This is the safe reformatted message view. You can tap on the ⛶ icon to view the less safe original message and to hide this message. Reformatting messages takes some time, depending on the size of the message and the speed of your device. Sometimes the original message must be viewed to see QR codes.
You can select text to format it
This will fetch the title at the entered address
Geographic location, serial numbers, file names, etc.
The Android photo picker no longer passes file names
Use a small font for the source text
Replace source text by translated text
Tap the text to be translated
Private key does not match any encryption keys
Reminders can be enabled again in the send settings
Most providers and email clients ignore receipt requests
This file is not yet known to VirusTotal
%1$s virus scanners report this file as malicious
VirusTotal is analyzing the file, this may take a while …
Did you intend to add an attachment?
Some other email clients cannot handle file names longer than 60 characters
Hard bounces damage the email reputation of the original sender!
Not all attachments have been downloaded
This will no longer be shown, nor will attachments be downloaded automatically
This dialog can be enabled again via the three-dots menu in the top action bar
PGP end-to-end encryption needs to be configured first
Use the padlock to decrypt the message
Verify the signature to show the message text
Message is not signed or encrypted
Can be used in case of new certificates, etc.
Message signature valid but not confirmed
Message signature valid but not confirmed: %1$s
Key for signature verification is missing
The email address of the sender and signature do not match
This public key is currently not valid
Initially, the search is performed on the device. To search the server too, tap the \'search again\' button.
Using the search index: whole words only
Searching via the search index is fast, but only finds whole words.
Searching for text in messages, when there are a large number of messages, might not work on some servers
\'%s\' means that the mail server doesn\'t support searching in message texts
Searching for messages by size, when there are a large number of messages, might not work on some servers
This will check the password, without sending it (using k-anonymization), and not the email address!
Although Android cannot display all HTML, it will be sent as-is
When sending a message, the image is copied into the message from the selected location. So, don\'t delete the image file!
Summarize the message with configured AI integration
Stop processing rules after executing this rule
If the rule is part of a group, the processing of all rules of this group will be stopped
Using this condition will always download the message text, which may slow down the synchronization of the message list
This action will be applied to new messages arriving in the folder %1$s
From the end of the time condition
All messages in same conversation and folder
Check for automatically sent messages, no-reply addresses, etc.
Only one reply will be sent for any conversation, to avoid reply loops
This will send the intent \'%1$s\' with the extras \'%2$s\'
Permanent deletion is irreversible, so make sure the rule conditions are correct!
Try to avoid bridging notifications to other devices, such as smartwatches. Not all devices support this.
You can use the following placeholders: %1$s
This will ignore "do not disturb" rules
Number of days to synchronize / to keep messages
Number of message downloaded / headers fetched
Long press a folder for options, like adding a folder to the navigation menu for quick access
To limit battery and network usage not all folders and not all messages will be synchronized by default
Notification permissions are required for (account) alerts too. Notifications for new messages can be turned off in the settings.
If the data saver is enabled, the app will not be able to sync in the background and connection errors may occur.
E-mail servers sometimes block connections through a VPN. If this happens, only the e-mail provider can resolve this.
You can dismiss this dialog box to remove the notice.
If you have a question or a problem, please use the support menu to get help
Swipe left to trash; Swipe right to archive (if available); The swipe actions can be configured in the account settings
You can swipe left or right to cancel sending
Long press a message to start selecting multiple messages; Hold and swipe up or down to select more messages

An email client basically displays messages on an email server. An email server is responsible for filtering spam, not an email client. If you receive a lot of spam, please contact your email provider and don\'t blame the app!

Downloading messages can take some time, depending on the speed of the provider, internet connection, the device and on the number of messages. While downloading messages the app might respond slower.

By default, not all messages will be downloaded to limit storage space and battery and data usage. You can change this by long pressing a folder in the folder list and selecting \'Fetch more messages\'.

Since FairEmail by default always receives messages, Android will report FairEmail as always being active. Therefore it might look as if FairEmail is always consuming battery power although this is in fact not the case.
By default, FairEmail reformats messages for privacy and security reasons. To view the original message, tap the \'full screen\' icon above the message text.

The design is intentionally not distracting, but kept highly functional. There are many options to customize the appearance, but please understand that it is impossible to make everybody completely happy at the same time.
Spam filtering should be done by the email server and cannot be done reliably on a battery powered device with limited capabilities.
By moving messages to and from the spam folder, the email server "learns" what spam is
This is a summary of the content of a raw message file. Save the raw message with the save icon in the action bar to view all content.
The title and the link address are different
Information will be retrieved from ipinfo.io
Do you have a question or problem?
Do not ask this again for %1$s
This can be undone in the privacy-settings tab page
This message is very large and this may cause problems!
Fetching message again from the server
This message no longer exists on the email server

Developing FairEmail took literally thousands of hours and, despite that, most of the features are free to use. FairEmail takes your privacy seriously and doesn\'t show ads and doesn\'t use tracking or analytics to earn money. To maintain and support FairEmail in the long run, some convenience and advanced features are not free to use. FairEmail shows a small message to remind you of this, which will be removed if you purchase the pro features.
Whichever features are chosen as pro features, there is always someone who complains that a feature should be free. Please don\'t be that person.
FairEmail initiates a Play Store purchase, but ultimately Google manages the entire purchase process. So please don\'t blame the app in case of any problems!
Buying pro features will allow you to use all current and future pro features, will keep this app maintained, and supported.
Why are the pro features so expensive?
Can I use the Google Play Family Library?
How can I restore a purchase (on another device)?
FairEmail needs your help. Tap to buy pro features to keep the project going or turn off this message.
